title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: So I have an 820-00840 that is not powering on. It was working, just had a couple corroded capacitor ends so I touched them up and UC'd the board. It now draws 0A @ 20V, but had PP#V# and PPBUS is 13.1V. Not sure what the heck is going on. Any suggestions?

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
Why the people like so much to pass a board through UC?
To clean few caps, use toothbrush!

Now you can have knocked off components, or broken traces.
Did you use sweep function at least?
Did you dry the board correctly?

Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS at least?

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: yes

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Seem to be missing PP3V3_S4 an PP5V_S4

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: no pp5v_s5 either

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: I've got ONE reply for 3 questions; what should I understand???

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
you actually asked 4 questions.

Answer  1. Because there was flux that may have gone under U7800 because the cap I replaced was right above it.

Answer 2. Yes I used the sweep function

Answer 3. I dried for 1 hour

Answer 4. I was getting PP3V3_S5. When I search for SUS I don’t see anything for that.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
You cannot get S4 voltages, nor signals, if missing 3V3_SUS.
This imply missing PM_SLP_SUS_L and you have to find why PCH pulls down that signal.
Start checking PCH's RTC signals and U7800 at page 60.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
PM_DSW_PWRGD - 0V
PCH_INTRUDER_L - .398V

PP3V1_RTC - .398V
RTC_RESET_L - .398V
PCH_SRTCRST_L - .398V
PPDCPRTC_PSH - .340V

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
R7835 was broken after replacing:

PM_DSW_PWRGD - 0V
PCH_INTRUDER_L - 2.8V

PP3V1_RTC - 3.08V
RTC_RESET_L - 3.08V
PCH_SRTCRST_L - 3.08V
PPDCPRTC_PSH - 1.1V

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: on PP3V3_S0 I have 500 Ohms to GND.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: PM_DSW_PWRGD must be high, if 3V3_S5 is present.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: ok, yeah it is present

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Does 530 Ohms on PP3V3_S0 seem low? I don't have another board for reference, besides an 820-00875 that is a donor.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
00840/75 are almost the same.
You should compare diode mode readings (red probe at ground), not ohm scale.

"and U7800 at page 60."
???

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: I'm not sure which signals are important

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
Start with U7800 (7 OF 10).
Also check 3V1_RTC (10 OF 10) at page 61.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Ok, so all of the outputs seem to be there, PP3V1_RTC IS 3.1 volts

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
PMIC_EN_P3V3S5?

Check all resistors around U7800.
You may need to reball it...

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
PMIC_EN_P3V3S5 = 3.28V
I will check resistors and if they are all good, will reball PMIC.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Then you MUST have 3V3_S5 present now...

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Reballed PMIC and no change.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: You didn't comment about 3V3_S5...

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: It is present

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.
I supposed both signals, as PM_RSMRST_L too, are high already.

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: I'm looking at this board again. I found R 7062 is 263 Ohms. I replaced it and board went to 20 @ .02 amps

title: 820-00840 Not powering on after UC
message: Which voltages present from power on sequence?
